pr_title: [#2120] Fix calculation of duration of current accounting period

timeline.bodyText:
FMPOV we should also allow to set a future date as an effectiveSince date. For example, I would like to start a plan from the next month. In this case, I should be able to set it now and not wait until 12 AM UTC on the first day of the next month. IMHO if the effective date is in the future, we can simply ignore and no need to calculate any limits.
If we don't want to allow any future date as an effectiveSince, then I think a corresponding validation should be  there while adding/updating tenant information. WDYT?

timeline.bodyText: As per the master branch, the configured maxBytes value is returned when the effectiveSince date lies in the future. Now by returning zero, it means that no messages are accepted for this tenant (as the allowedMaxBytes is zero bytes) until the plan actually starts as per the effectiveSince date. I think it makes more sense not to allow any messages until the plan actually starts.

timeline.message:
Fix wording in Management API

Signed-off-by: Kai Hudalla <kai.hudalla@bosch.io>

[#2120] Fix calculation of duration of current accounting period

The calculation had been using days granularity when determining how
much of the current accounting period's contingent has been used up
already.
If a lot of resources had been used towards the end of the previous
period, this could lead to situations where resources used during
tte previous period would be accounted for the current accounting period
as well.

Fixes #2120

Signed-off-by: Kai Hudalla <kai.hudalla@bosch.io>

Improve documentation of resource limits in Management API

Added specifics of accounting period modes.
